lexUnit.name: gasp.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: catch one's breath with an open mouth, owing to pain or astonishment. strain to obtain (air) by gasping.

sentence.text: Brian gasped with the pain , and could n't breathe .
He gasped with pain as the head of the smaller boy caught him in the stomach .
In 1986 , on their first tour to Britain for years , the Bolshoi 's artistic director , Yuri Grigorovich , revealed Mukhamedov to the ballet world , and it gasped with astonishment .
I can … ’ but the words were stopped in him and he seemed to suffocate and gasp with the sense of a power beyond the Cages that he had sensed briefly before .
Suddenly , she was clinging to him , her hands in his dark hair , gasping with pent-up desire as his hands swept up to her breasts .
Ronni gasped with dismay .
She nearly gasped with dismay at the shock that shivered down into her tummy .
Louisa gasped with delight to see the man and his reflection travel together so fluently .
Alexandra and Lyddy gasped in unison .
A few seconds later , he gasped in realization : had n't the scientist referred to his tardy colleague as ` he " ?
He turned , elbows beneath him , gasping in the foul air , his chest heaving .
It was so beautifully cut that Joanna gasped in admiration .
She had disappeared , strategically , into the folds of her little black dress , leaving Karen gasping in her underslip .
Thessy gasped at such blasphemy , while I scowled at Ellen 's blackmail .
And as Fabia gasped at the implication she saw behind that statement Lubor was going on , ` It is I who asks you , for myself .
The jewels sparkled in the candlelight and the guests gasped at the sheer magnificence of the piece .
He slowly lifted the hand which had been clutching his , opened it and very gently implanted a kiss on its palm , and laughed when she gasped at the caress .
Symptom : Larger fish , in particular gasping at the surface .
Joshua gasped as his heavy frame shook .
Alice suddenly gasped as though an invisible blade had pricked her flesh ; the smile remained , though , and became even more serene .
